{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3140181,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-05T20:47:58.640Z","cooked":"

The Pneumatics Chapter it’s still a w.i.p. but the whole site is controlled with versioning via Github. Others can submit content, make edits and etc with markdown files and git commits. It’s designed so every team can have one collaborative source to go to for things not covered in the Wpilib docs. Pnuematics is a section that is fairly limited I thought so it was a good place to start off.

Let me know what you think and if there’s any issues let me know. You can also submit issues to the GitHub page for frc0. This is also where new content files can be submitted for entry to the knowledge base.

Is this, like your previous resource threads, done with the assistance of ChatGPT or other AI driven text generators?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-02-05T22:04:15.203Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":30,"reads":336,"readers_count":335,"score":237.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":425869,"topic_slug":"i-started-a-collaborative-knowledge-base-called-frczero-org-i-made-a-sample-about-pnuematics-is-this-useful","display_username":"MikLast","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23994,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"You have 45 seconds to reply"},"post_url":"/t/i-started-a-collaborative-knowledge-base-called-frczero-org-i-made-a-sample-about-pnuematics-is-this-useful/425869/2","custom_user_title":"You have 45 seconds to reply","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3140211,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-05T22:23:15.318Z","cooked":"

Some text might be for markdown generation like tables for vendor parts, but the intention is for this to be written by students, coaches, parents and not have to rely on AI to piece together all of the data from around the FRC interwebs.

The content is being written manually and I’m checking it as I’m going but I’m prone to errors as well. Hence why I want the guide that I can point to and not rely on my memory.

As team 8795 we are also trying to create essentially same thing in Turkish. Would it be okay if we use translated version of some of your texts?
Project: https://dokuman.chaotics8795.com/

Feel free! You can also add your Turkish version notes to the frc0 project as an alternative version. The way this is setup you can specify a target language for a content page. If someone with the turkish language settings in their browser visits if there’s a turkish version that will load instead.

A bit off topic, but, out of interest, would you like to translate the unofficial mechanism encyclopedia? It is currently only in English and Portuguese and I’d love for it to be translated into Turkish, especially as the number of teams in your region is growing so quickly.

This is a link to it if you want to check it out:

projectb.net.au

The Unofficial FRC Mechanism Encyclopedia – Project Bucephalus

Let me know if you or your team is interested, you can DM me on here or send me an email at pbmechanisms@gmail.com

I love this idea, the format is great. One thing: is there a way to submit minor correction suggestions? For example, on this table, I feel like it would be more understandable if this said “There is a jumper on the PCM to switch between 12V and 24V”, rather than “There is a jumper on the PCM for this!”

image1275×245 74.5 KB

I wanna get every detail captured and answered
